content:
There is a fundamental contradiction between your description (Bouncing Ball) and your logic! 
Your code counts integer points on a direct diagonal line, not physical corner hits...
As noticed by 5DN1L, your test with 3 3 should give 0 as result according to your rules, not 2 (which is simply the number of cells crossed).

Formatting
* Please study the formatting syntax on this page: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement , and format your statement properly as described in the points below.

Goal
* Please format "W" and "H" as [[variables]].

Input
* Please format "W" and "H" as [[variables]].

* Please add "space-separated" before "integers".

Constraints
* Please format "W" and "H" as [[variables]].

* Please change 1000 to 20.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. write answer.

Cases
* Each test and its validator should cover the same scenario with slightly different inputs and outputs. Please revise all the validators accordingly.

* Please include a pair of cases where W > H.

* I don't understand why the expected output for 3 3 is 2. Is the path taken by the ball in this case: 0 0 -> 1 1 -> 2 2 -> 3 3?

Thanks.
